1343 Arizona Attorney General accepted $200,000 in what seems to be a quid pro quo arrangement, granting the Democratic Attorneys General Association—via its initiative, the States United Democracy Center—prosecutorial authority to target political opponents. posted 1 day ago by blue5707 68 comments award share report block Breanna Morello @BreannaMorello • 2d 🚨MUST READ🚨 New BOMBSHELL claims are being made by attorney Christina Bobb on AZ “fake” electors case. She says it appears the Arizona Attorney General accepted $200,000 in what seems to be a quid pro quo arrangement, granting the Democratic Attorneys General Association—via

I moved here in mid 2023 and will probably end up moving out. The people hare are so socially isolationist that you can barely even start a conversation with someone. The drivers are total passive-aggressive shit. The government is corrupt to the core. The only thing that seems to work (and I'm sure there is corruption here too) is the AzDOT. They at least try to keep their roads operational. I ended up getting a cat for friendship and socialization because the actual humans here (for the most part) are all tied up in their religious or social politics and treat 'outsiders' like garbage. And no, I didn't move here from California.
